intro: Euphorbia bwambensis, commonly known as the Bwambé Thornplant, is a spiny shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna habitats. Its unique morphology and adaptive features make it well-suited to arid environments.
